definition: public land/land in common use

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
absolutely fair and reasonable (idiom); equitable
tragedy of the commons (economics)
business address

sentences.english: The most important aspect of necessity that we must now recognize, is the necessity of abandoning the commons in breeding.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須承認必然性最重要一點，是放棄生育的公地。

sentences.english: Make clear on distributinging card, 5 buildings are to hand in an office ground of a branch.
sentences.chinese: 分佈牌上註明，5樓是上交所一個部門的辦公地。

sentences.english: The statement may include a statement that the registered office is also discontinued.
sentences.chinese: 該聲明能夠聲明註冊辦公地也不再存在。

sentences.english: The statement may include your firm sta majord out that the registered office is also discontinued.
sentences.chinese: 該聲明可以聲明註冊辦公地也不再生活。

sentences.english: Common right to land which was the most essential feature of common land also decreased.
sentences.chinese: 土地的公共權利是公地的基本特徵。

sentences.english: As the human population has increased, the commons has had to be abandoned in one aspect after another.
sentences.chinese: 隨着人類人口增加，公地的觀點必須逐一放棄。

sentences.english: At this point, the inherent logic of the commons remorselessly generates tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 這時，公地的內在邏輯無情地導致悲劇。

sentences.english: You walk into work a couple minutes early and head straight to your desk.
sentences.chinese: 提前兩分鐘進入辦公地，你徑直撲向辦公桌。

sentences.english: The National Parks present another instance of the working out of the tragedy of the commons.
sentences.chinese: 國家公園是公地悲劇的另一個例子。

definition: to be honest/to show sincerity
lit. deal sincerely and fairly (idiom); frank and open-minded/plain speaking/Let's talk frankly and openly between ourselves./to put one's cards on the table
to have an in depth conversation/to have intimate talks/to discuss thoroughly
to give one's bare heart into sb else's keeping (idiom); sb has one's absolute confidence/to trust completely/to confide in sb with entire sincerity
not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4

definition: to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
a long talk
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
to lay one's cards on the table
variant of 原原本本[yuan2 yuan2 ben3 ben3]
honest/forthcoming/to confess
personal matters
lit. to put everything out including the tray/to reveal everything/to make a clean breast of it all
to trust one another fully/to treat sb with sincerity
lit. fluently saying all one wants (idiom); to preach freely on one's favorite topic/to hold forth to one's heart's content
to explain
